intro: Hieracium callunetorum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces yellow-orange flower heads composed of numerous small florets, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium callunetorum is often found in disturbed soils and can form dense colonies in suitable environments.
